Print milestone entries with enhanced CLI formatting

Source: R/print_milestone_cli.R
print_milestone_cli.Rd

Format and print milestone entries from the milestones database using the cli package for enhanced console output with clickable links, better formatting, and visual structure.

Usage

print_milestone_cli(
  ms,
  include = c("authors", "keywords", "subjects", "aspects", "media", "references"),
  show_images = TRUE
)

Arguments

ms

A data frame from the milestone() table (one or more rows), or a numeric vector of milestone IDs (mid) to look up

include

Character vector specifying which sections to include. Options: "authors", "keywords", "subjects", "aspects", "media", "references". Default is all sections.

show_images

Logical; if TRUE, show image information in output. Default is TRUE.

Value

NULL (invisibly). The formatted milestone is printed to the console using cli functions.

Details

This is a convenience wrapper around print_milestone() with result = "cli". You can also call print_milestone(ms, result = "cli") directly.

This function uses the cli package to create enhanced console output with:

  • Clickable hyperlinks for media items and references

  • Better visual structure with headers and lists

  • Color and formatting for improved readability

If multiple milestones are provided (either as multiple rows or multiple IDs), each milestone is printed separately with visual separation.

See also

print_milestone() for the main print function with multiple output formats

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Print a single milestone
print_milestone_cli(53)

# Print multiple milestones
print_milestone_cli(c(53, 54, 55))

# Print with only selected sections
print_milestone_cli(53, include = c("authors", "references"))

# Equivalent using print_milestone directly
print_milestone(53, result = "cli")
} # }
